entityId.localType: National Archives of Australia Series Number

nameEntry.part: Correspondence files, annual single number series

biogHist.abstract: This series of Correspondence files was created by the Northern Territory Administration when the Northern Territory was under the control of the Commonwealth Government. It was the main series of administrative correspondence and policy files for the Administration. The series includes many files relating to the welfare of children, both Aboriginal and non Aboriginal.
biogHist.p: Under the Archives Act 1983, for most Commonwealth records, the date the records were created, determines whether they are open for public access or not. Once records fall in the Open access period, that is 20 years after the date of the creation of the record, they become open for researchers to look at. Some records, however, continue to be subject to restrictions for various reasons. Other records are only closed because they have not yet been examined in detail by Archivists.

On Recordsearch, the search engine of the National Archives, you can see if a record is open or not and whether it has been digitized. Sometimes you will see the phrases 'Not yet examined' or 'Open with exception' under the name of the record. In these cases researchers need to contact the National Archives to ask for them to be examined with the possibility of being opened for access or to apply for access to closed records. The National Archives website provides further information about applying for access to records

This very large series of Correspondence files was created by the Northern Territory Administration when the Northern Territory was under the control of the Commonwealth Government. It was the main series of administrative correspondence and policy files for the Administration. The files contain letters, memoranda, reports and other documents passing between the Administration, Commonwealth departments and other outside agencies. The series includes many files relating to the welfare of children, both Aboriginal and non Aboriginal. These include records of the State Children's Council and its successors.

Welfare Branch - St Mary's Hostel - Policy and development (1956 - 1958)

descriptiveNote.p: The National Archives of Australia series F1 contains files relating to Essington House: NAA: F1, 1973-8335 Department of Aboriginal Affairs - Aspects of the restructuring of the criminal justice section in Northern Territory, 1973-1975; NAA: F1, 1971/1236 Administration of Justice - NT, 1971-1973..

cpfRelation.relationEntry: National Archives of Australia - Darwin Office - Contact Details
Her Majesty's Gaol and Labour Prison, Alice Springs (1938 - 1996)

descriptiveNote.p: The National Archives of Australia Series F1 Correspondence Files, contains a number of items relating to Her Majesty's Gaol and Labour Prison, Alice Springs: F1, 1972/2581 HM Gaol and labour prison - Alice Springs, 1967-1972; F1, 62/3829 Hm Gaol and Labour Prison Alice Springs 1962-1965; F1, 1959/359 Transfer of Prisoners Darwin to Alice Springs, 1959-60; F1, 1958/1051. Alice Springs Gaol HM Prison Alice Springs, 1958-1959; F1, 1966/623, 1962-1967. Reports by Comptroller of prisons on visits to the Alice Springs Gaol; F1, 1962/3981 "Transfer of Prisoners Darwin and Alice Springs, 1962-64; F1, 1966/84, HM prisons - Alice Springs - Reports by visiting justices of peace 1956-69; F1, 1970/815 WB Receiving Home - Alice Springs - Bradshaw House 1964 -1971.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: State Children's Council, Northern Territory, Australian Government (1930 - 1959)

descriptiveNote.p: The National Archives of Australia series F1 contains items relating to the State Children's Council: NAA: F1, 1950/402A State Children's Council Appointments and Terminations.
